00017 // Represents an expression that uses arithmetic and logical operators
00018 // on a set of integral variables.
00019 class IntArithLogical : public FiniteLattice, public LogicalCond
00020 {
00021 public:
00022         // the information content of this expression/level in the lattice
00023         typedef enum
00024         {
00025                 // this object is uninitialized
00026                 uninitialized, 
00027                 // no information is known about the value of the variable
00028                 bottom,
00029                 // we have a specific formula for this variable (may be True = no information, or False = full information)
00030                 known/*, 
00031                 // this variable can be either positive or negative
00032                 top*/
00033         } infContent;
00034         
00035         infContent level;
00036 
00037         
00038         // The possible comparison operations
00039         typedef enum {eq=SpearOp::Equal, le=SpearOp::SgnLTE} cmpOps;
00040         
00041         // The possible logical operations
00042         typedef enum {andOp=SpearOp::AndOp, orOp=SpearOp::OrOp, notOp=SpearOp::NotOp} logOps;
00043         
00044         class exprLeafOrNode: public virtual SpearExpr
00045         {
00046                 public:
00047                 typedef enum {eLeaf, lNode} elt;
00048                 virtual elt elType()=0;
00049                 
00050                 typedef enum {isTrue, exprKnown, isFalse} infContent;
00051                 virtual infContent getLevel()=0;
00052                 
00053                 // Sets this expression to True, returning true if this causes
00054                 // the expression to be modified and false otherwise.
00055                 virtual bool setToTrue()=0;
00056                 
00057                 // Sets this expression to False, returning true if this causes
00058                 // the expression to be modified and false otherwise.
00059                 virtual bool setToFalse()=0;
00060                 
00061                 // Negate this logical expression.
00062                 // Returns true if this causes this logicNode to change, false otherwise.
00063                 virtual bool notUpd()=0;
00064                 
00065                 virtual bool operator==(exprLeafOrNode& that)=0;
00066                 bool operator!=(exprLeafOrNode& that) { return !(*this == that); }
00067                 
00068                 // Information order on affine relationships with the least information (True) being highest
00069                 // and most information (False) being lowest. Some expressions are not comparable since
00070                 // their sets of accepted points are not strictly related to each other.
00071                 virtual bool operator<=(exprLeafOrNode& that)=0;
00072                 bool operator<(exprLeafOrNode& that) { return (*this != that) && (*this <= that); }
00073                 bool operator>=(exprLeafOrNode& that) { return (*this == that) && !(*this <= that); }
00074                 bool operator>(exprLeafOrNode& that) { return (*this != that) && (*this >= that); }
00075                 
00076                 // Returns a human-readable string representation of this expression.
00077                 // Every line of this string must be prefixed by indent.
00078                 // The last character of the returned string should not be '\n', even if it is a multi-line string.
00079                 virtual std::string str(std::string indent="")=0;
00080 
00081                 virtual ~exprLeafOrNode() {}
00082         };
00083         
00084         class logicNode;
00085         
00086         // A leaf expression: a*x cmpOp b*y + c, where x and y are variables and a,b and c are integers 
00087         // These expressions are used conservatively: they must contain no more information than is actually 
00088         // known to be true. In other words, given a set R of points (x,y) that satisfy the real condition,
00089         // and the set A of points that satisfy the approximation stored in exprLeaf. R must be a subset of A.
00090         // Lattice: isTrue     (all points x,y are accepted when some should not be: zero knowledge)
00091         //         exprKnown   (exactly correct set of points x,y are accepted: partial knowledge)
00092         //          isFalse    (no points x,y are accepted: perfect knowledge)
00093         class exprLeaf: public virtual exprLeafOrNode
00094         {
00095                 friend class logicNode;
00096                 
00097                 protected:
00098                 SpearOp cmp;
00099                 int a, b, c;
00100                 varID x, y;
00101                 
00102                 exprLeafOrNode::infContent level;
00103                 
00104                 std::list<SpearAbstractVar*> vars;
00105                 SpearAbstractVar* outVar;
00106                 std::string logExpr;
00107                 bool varsExprInitialized;
00108                 
00109                 exprLeaf(SpearOp cmp, int a, varID x, int b, varID y, int c);
00110                 
00111                 public:
00112                 exprLeaf(cmpOps cmp, int a, varID x, int b, varID y, int c);
00113                 
00114                 exprLeaf(const exprLeaf& that);
00115                 
00116                 protected:
00117                 // divide out from a, b and c any common factors, reducing the triple to its normal form
00118                 // return true if this modifies this constraint and false otherwise
00119                 bool normalize();
00120                 
00121                 // Sets this expression to True, returning true if this causes
00122                 // the expression to be modified and false otherwise.
00123                 bool setToTrue();
00124                 
00125                 // Sets this expression to False, returning true if this causes
00126                 // the expression to be modified and false otherwise.
00127                 bool setToFalse();
00128                 
00129                 infContent getLevel();
00130                 
00131                 // computes vas and logExpr
00132                 void computeVarsExpr();
00133                 
00134                 public:
00135                         
00136                 // returns a list of the names of all the variables needed to represent the logical 
00137                 // expression in this object
00138                 const std::list<SpearAbstractVar*>& getVars();
00139                 
00140                 // returns the variable that represents the result of this expression
00141                 SpearAbstractVar* getOutVar();
00142                 
00143                 // returns the SPEAR Format expression that represents the constraint in this object
00144                 const std::string& getExpr();
00145                 
00146                 // Returns a human-readable string representation of this expression.
00147                 // Every line of this string must be prefixed by indent.
00148                 // The last character of the returned string should not be '\n', even if it is a multi-line string.
00149                 std::string str(std::string indent="");
00150                 std::string str(std::string indent="") const;
00151                 std::string genStr(std::string indent="") const;
00152                 
00153                 elt elType(){ return exprLeafOrNode::eLeaf; }
00154                 
00155                 SpearExpr* copy();
00156                 
00157                 // Negate this logical expression.
00158                 // Returns true if this causes this logicNode to change, false otherwise.
00159                 bool notUpd();
00160                 
00161                 // And-s this expression with the given expression, if possible
00162                 // Return true if the conjunction is possible and this now contains the conjunction expression and
00163                 //        false if it is not possible.
00164                 // If the conjunction is possible, modified is set to true if the conjunction causes
00165                 //    this to change and false otherwise.
00166                 bool andExprs(const exprLeaf& that, bool &modified);
00167                 // returns the same thing as orExprs but doesn't actually perform the conjunction
00168                 bool andExprsTest(const exprLeaf& that);
00169                 
00170                 // Or-s this expression with the given expression, if possible
00171                 // Return true if the disjunction is possible and this now contains the disjunction expression and
00172                 //        false if it is not possible.
00173                 // If the conjunction is possible, modified is set to true if the conjunction causes
00174                 //    this to change and false otherwise.
00175                 bool orExprs(const exprLeaf& that, bool &modified);
00176                 // returns the same thing as andExprs but doesn't actually perform the disjunction
00177                 bool orExprsTest(const exprLeaf& that);
00178                 
00179                 bool operator==(exprLeafOrNode& that);
00180                 
00181                 // Information order on affine relationships with the least information (True) being highest
00182                 // and most information (False) being lowest. Some expressions are not comparable since
00183                 // their sets of accepted points are not strictly related to each other.
00184                 bool operator<=(exprLeafOrNode& that);
00185         };
00186         
00187         // An internal node that represents a logical connective between the affine relations
00188         class logicNode: public virtual exprLeafOrNode
00189         {
00190                 std::list<exprLeafOrNode*> children;
00191                 SpearOp logOp;
00192                 exprLeafOrNode::infContent level;
00193                 
00194                 bool varsExprInitialized;
00195                 std::list<SpearAbstractVar*> vars;
00196                 SpearAbstractVar*       outVar;
00197                 std::string logExpr;
00198                                 
00199                 public:
00200                 logicNode(logOps logOp);
00201                 
00202                 // constructor for logOp==notOp, which has a single child
00203                 logicNode(logOps logOp, exprLeafOrNode* child);
00204                 
00205                 // constructor for logOp==andOp, orOp and xorOp, which have 2+ children
00206                 logicNode(logOps logOp, exprLeafOrNode* childA, exprLeafOrNode* childB);
00207                 
00208                 // constructor for logOp==andOp, orOp and xorOp, which have 2+ children
00209                 logicNode(logOps logOp, const std::list<exprLeafOrNode*>& children);
00210                 
00211                 logicNode(const logicNode& that);
00212                 
00213                 ~logicNode();
00214                 
00215                 // add a new child to this node
00216                 void addChild(exprLeafOrNode* child);
00217                 
00218                 protected:
00219                 // propagates all the true and false sub-terms upwards through the tree, pruning the appropriate portions
00220                 // returns two if this causes the logicNode to change and false otherwise
00221                 bool normalize();
00222                 
00223                 public:
00224                 // Sets this expression to True, returning true if this causes
00225                 // the expression to be modified and false otherwise.
00226                 bool setToTrue();
00227                 
00228                 // Sets this expression to False, returning true if this causes
00229                 // the expression to be modified and false otherwise.
00230                 bool setToFalse();

00235                 // expression in this object

00240

00242                 const std::string& getExpr();
00243                 
00244                 // Returns a human-readable string representation of this expression.
00245                 // Every line of this string must be prefixed by indent.
00246                 // The last character of the returned string should not be '\n', even if it is a multi-line string.
00247                 std::string str(std::string indent="");
00248                 std::string str(std::string indent="") const;
00249                 std::string genStr(std::string indent="") const;
00250                 
00251                 protected:
00252                 void computeVarsExpr();
00253                 
00254                 public:
00255                 elt elType(){ return exprLeafOrNode::lNode; }
00256                 
00257                 SpearExpr* copy();
00258                 
00259                 // Negate this logical expression.
00260                 // Returns true if this causes this logicNode to change, false otherwise.
00261                 bool notUpd();
00262                 
00263                 // given a 2-level expression tree, collects all the permutations of grandchildren
00264                 // from each child branch into conjunct logicNodes and saves them in newChildren.
00265                 // Thus, (A^B^C)v(D^E^F) would become the list (A^D),(A^E),(A^F),(B^D),(B^E),(B^F),(C^D),(C^E),(C^F).
00266                 // The function works recursively, one child at a time.
00267                 // newChildren: The list where we'll save the new conjuncts
00268                 // newConjOrig: Accumulated stack of grandchildren that will be combined to form each conjunct
00269                 //              Thus, for input (A^B)v(C^D)v(D^E)v(F^G)v(H^I), the contents of newConjOrig
00270                 //              may be A,C,E,F, with H or I to be added when the function recurses again.
00271                 // curChild: Iterator that refers to the current child we're processing. The conjuncts
00272                 //           are formed whenever curChild reaches the end of children.
00273                 void genChildrenConj(std::list<exprLeafOrNode*>& newChildren, std::list<exprLeafOrNode*> newConjOrig, 
00274                                      std::list<exprLeafOrNode*>::const_iterator curChild);
00275                 
00276                 // ANDs this and that, storing the result in this.
00277                 // Returns true if this causes this logicNode to change, false otherwise.
00278                 bool andUpd(logicNode& that);
00279 
00280                 // OR this and that, storing the result in this.
00281                 // Returns true if this causes this logicNode to change, false otherwise.
00282                 bool orUpd(logicNode& that);
00283                 
00284                 // Removes all instances of p*var with (q*var + r) and adjusts all relations that involve var
00285                 // accordingly.
00286                 // Returns true if this causes the logicNode object to change and false otherwise.
00287                 bool replaceVar(varID var, int p, int q, int r);
00288                 
00289                 // Removes all facts that relate to the given variable, possibly replacing them 
00290                 // with other facts that do not involve the variable but could be inferred through
00291                 // the removed facts. (i.e. if we have x<y ^ y<z and wish to remove y, the removed 
00292                 // expressions may be replaced with x<z or just True)
00293                 // Returns true if this causes the logicNode object to change and false otherwise.
00294                 bool removeVar(varID var);
00295                 
00296                 protected:
00297                 // generic function used by orUpd and andUpd to insert new term into a disjunction
00298                 // newChildren - The new list of children that will eventually replace children. We will be trying to
00299                 //               insert newTerm into newChildren.
00300                 void insertNewChildOr(std::list<exprLeafOrNode*>& newChildren, exprLeafOrNode* newTerm);
00301                 
00302                 // compares two different children lists, returning true if they're equal and false otherwise
00303                 bool eqChildren(std::list<exprLeafOrNode*>& one, std::list<exprLeafOrNode*>& two);
00304                 
00305                 public:
00306                 bool operator==(exprLeafOrNode& that);
00307                 
00308                 // Information order on affine relationships with the least information (True) being highest
00309                 // and most information (False) being lowest. Some expressions are not comparable since
00310                 // their sets of accepted points are not strictly related to each other.
00311                 bool operator<=(exprLeafOrNode& that);
00312         };

00421

00428

00430         // returns true if this causes the expression to change and false otherwise
00431         bool assign(int a, varID x, int b, varID y, int c);

00463 class IntArithLogicalPlacer : public UnstructuredPassIntraAnalysis
00464 {
00465         public:
00466         void visit(const Function& func, const DataflowNode& n, NodeState& state);
00467         
00468         protected:
00469         // points trueIneqFact and falseIneqFact to freshly allocated objects that represent the true and false
00470         // branches of the control flow guarded by the given expression. They are set to NULL if our representation
00471         // cannot represent one of the expressions.
00472         // doFalseBranch - if =true, falseIneqFact is set to the correct false-branch condition and to NULL otherwise
00473         static void setTrueFalseBranches(SgExpression* expr, 
00474                                      IntArithLogicalFact **trueIneqFact, IntArithLogicalFact **falseIneqFact, 
00475                                      bool doFalseBranch);
00476 };
